subject: Cybersecurity
title: Hash Functions: Digital Fingerprints
description: A short lesson to help you apply Hash Functions: Digital Fingerprints.

hook.text: How do you prove a file hasn't been tampered with â€” without comparing every single byte?

buildup.text: A hash function takes any input and produces a fixed-size fingerprint. Even a tiny change creates a wildly different output.

discovery.text: SHA-256 always outputs 64 hex characters. Hashing 'hello' vs 'hello!' gives wildly different results.

twist.text: Hashing is one-way. You can create the fingerprint, but you can't reconstruct the original from it.

climax.text: Hash functions verify downloads, passwords, blockchain transactions, and digital evidence integrity.

punchline.text: Change one letter, change the entire fingerprint.

quiz.question: What is a key property of cryptographic hash functions?
options: A tiny input change completely changes the output
